intro: Hibbertia robur, commonly known as the broad-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers with distinctive, recurved petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with woody stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. Hibbertia robur thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Its flowers attract nectar-feeding birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance in native ecosystems.
